HOW WELL I REMEMBER! I was 10 years old, when on 7 Dec I heard "The Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor". I just kicked the dirt and thought "What is Pearl Harbor?"  I soon knew the reality of World War II, and the fact that family members were drafted.Our neighborhood and schools ran over in New Boston and DeKalb as people came from near and far to work at the depot! Years later, after graduation, I began a career there, and am one of the residents who retired from there!! I could write a book!!!
Very interesting story.   So many family members worked there through the years.  Lot of good memories
Congrats on 75!  My Dad worked there after the war, late 1940's.  I came across his old RRAD phone directory from that time period. YES, Kids, they did have phones way back then!  :-)

Col. Jacobs initiated the drug testing program at RRAD. I was tested the first day of the program. At the recognition ceremony, Col. Jacobs stopped me on stage, turned me to the audience, and stated that I understood the importance of being drug free....for me and my unborn baby. He then shook my hand and whispered in my ear he was proud of me and wished me the best. I was shy back in those days, and I blushed, but I thought it was very sweet.
When he was gathering information to analyze a situation, one of his most used phrases was "Well, what is the long pole in the tent?" My condolences to the family.
Linda Jacobs, I am so sorry to hear of your loss. You and your family are in my prayers.

LOL, guys, the "training wheels" are only there for the test.  That way the driver can push the vehicle to its limits without worrying about crashing the vehicle and damaging it, while trying to test the ESC system.  The ESC system is designed to stop rollovers so the driver puts the MRAP through it paces attempting to make it roll over to ensure the ESC system is working as intended.  The "training wheels" come off after the test and are not part of what our soldiers use downrange or in CONUS.

Think of it as a house that has 6 people living in it. If there are people making terroristic threats outside that house, would you rather watch 6 open doors with 1 person at each door or 3 open doors with 2 people each? 
When you limit the places a hostile person can enter, you can effectively provide better security by limiting access points and doubling the security. Sure, it may be more congested traffic but it's not a perfect world. It may be an inconvenience, but a way to remedy that is to plan accordingly (ie: leave earlier in the am, and wait for heavy traffic to lighten in the pm). Or, just suck it up and deal with it. Everything can't be catered to everyone's individual request and complaint.

Attention, please.  Participants of this Facebook page will agree, not a single one of our US veterans should ever be in need, what with all the wealth in this country and all the billions in profit so many have made on the wars fought by these honorable warriors.  Sadly many of our veterans suffer daily and are in need.....Please do whatever you can, even if it is just $5.    

I've shared this post on the Facebook pages of  the Governor, Lt. Gov., Attorney General of the state of Texas, as well as the Facebook pages of the Texas Legislators, US Congress, US Military, and the Department of Defense.  ~ Triena Rogers
------------------------  
Today is the perfect day to step and do something to help a veteran! Nothing very complicated and for those near me locally this particular link helps veterans right here in Texas/Oklahoma in Texoma. Check this out, and if you can donate $5 today - do it! If you can do more .... go for it. This is an awesome program and 25 Veterans - who are currently homeless - will have a roof over their head very soon. What they are missing is the 'stuff' to go under the roof! By definition homelessness means you don't have plates, silverware, beds, chairs and all that stuff. This donation program will help make a house a home. http://www.tcog.com/vash/. An opportunity to do something that will immediately make a difference. And if you're not in my area check out your local area/State. Ready, set, go!  

http://www.tcog.com/vash/
